job_title: Building Operator in East York, ON
pros: I chose them to find something in me related to helping others as the building was designed for seniors "55 years " and older, the City of Toronto own the building but Woodgreen manages it.
cons: the operation manager was missed up! his highest desire is to act that everything is under his control while the reality is everybody working on his own! not real with his words "lier" the staff is very basic with very low income, they dislike working there but they are still working there I don't understand "Why" and I will never understand Why and it did not really matter for me anymore.

job_title: Senior Financial Analyst in Toronto, ON
pros:
Good health benefits
Work life balance
cons:
Lack of respect and recognition of your experience and ideas.
Insecure management team, limits your professional development and deliberately takes you out of communication / email chains even when it was your initiative. 
Too many times seen the management team taking credit for your initiatives.
New finance management have little industry experience and time and time again would request work which has no value to the company.

pros: Good colleagues, good team; the office environment was peaceful most of the time

For a place supposed to show empathy and understanding to others, this non-profit has none for its employees.
Management is terrible, and there is no room for growth whatsoever.

review_title: There are better places to work.
job_title: Early Childhood Educator in Toronto, ON
pros: Easily accessible by transit that's about it.
cons:
Way too many policies to sign off on each year, it's becoming more like a corporation than a non profit community oriented company. It's all about $$$.
- You don't feel valued, everyone is replaceable. 
- There is split shifts, and extended shifts and they say it's based on "program needs" and also 
throw out that you are only guaranteed number of hours so it could be split and extended however they want. 
-They are not very accommodating to people with family esp young children.

pros: Its an okay place to work and has a good focus on community
cons: Finance team keeps hiring really bad employees. New FP&A guy is incompetent ....and apparently has joined from CPA Ontario.......doesn't understand basics and not taking direction at all! where do they find these people!

pros: none. worst place to work
cons: alot of stuff with this company

pros: Agency more interested in promoting its' image rather than helping clients. Little respect for staff (both front line or lower management). More of a corporation than community service organisation. No pros to mention other than if you're senior management (Vice President, COO, CEO, President) then it's like pigs feeding off the trough. Fattening themselves with over inflated salaries and over inflated opinions of themselves and their importance to the organization (you're not that important - really)
cons: Too many to mention, see above. Corrupt, devious, speak horribly of staff behind their backs, two faced, disingenuous. Those are their GOOD points!

pros: You get many opportunties to try different types of positions because the organizaton provides a wide range of services.  As unionized staff, you get protection from the union so you can get a better chance for job security once you are in.
cons: This is a relatively large organization with typical beaucratic culture, especially from the central adminstration. It has a "business" culture that values competitive mind set and take pride to help the organization to bring "the prize" home among funders and in the non-profit world. You would enjoy the culture if you are into rules and will survive better if you are the outgoing type of person and will take every opportunity to show off your capability.

review_title: 'Yikes' is the only way I can sum it up
pros: The organization is a nonprofit, so the work does have an impact on the community.
cons:
Employees are overworked and underpaid.
Benefits are not the greatest. 
The organization doesn't provide employees with opportunities to grow. Lots of staff members are stuck in the same position for years. 
Their offices and locations are really run down as well as lack security.
Extremely poor leadership from management.
There is such high turnover meaning work gets pushed onto other staff members. When an employee leaves, HR just re-hires instead of taking the time to understand why that person left. It becomes a vicious cycle.

pros: You work independently, and you push yourself to better serve your clients
cons: Lack of training and lack of real outcomes. Sometimes staff will need to cover program expenses due to lack of funding just so that targets are met

review_title: I worked at Woodgreen for 5 years
